articles.title: Saudi Arabia introduces new rules banning sharia-violating names in public facilities across nation
articles.summary: Saudi Arabia has introduced new rules banning Sharia-violating names in public facilities across the nation. The regulations, approved by the Cabinet and published in the Umm Al-Qura Gazette, set unified naming standards, governance frameworks, and strict religious restrictions. Government entities must follow the rules, maintain official records, and issue bylaws to ensure names align with Islamic principles and national administrative standards.

articles.summary: Sebi is leveraging AI-driven tools to enhance regulatory compliance and surveillance, including a new system to assess cybersecurity preparedness. The market regulator's AI initiatives, such as Sebi Sudarshan, aim to monitor unauthorized digital activities and analyze corporate sentiment. This development underscores Sebi's commitment to strengthening risk-based supervision within the Indian securities market.

articles.title: Centre warns social media firms of legal action over unlawful content
articles.summary: The Parliamentary Standing Committee on the Ministry of Information and Broadcasting has also called for greater accountability of social media and intermediary platforms in relation to fake content and news.

articles.title: MeitY issues formal notice to X over Grok's  IT Act lapses
articles.summary: MeitY has issued a formal notice to X, citing serious lapses in statutory due diligence under the IT Act and Rules. The government is concerned about X's AI tool, Grok, generating and circulating obscene content, particularly targeting women and children. X has been directed to review Grok's framework, remove unlawful content, and take action against offending users within 72 hours.

articles.title: Niti Aayog drafts plan to shield senior citizens from digital scams
articles.summary: India is preparing a policy road map to protect senior citizens from digital scams, with Niti Aayog working on a multi-ministerial action plan. The plan will focus on digital literacy, stronger security and coordinated monitoring as cases of ‘digital arrest’ fraud rise. The initiative will form part of broader elderly care measures, with details likely in Budget 2026-27.

articles.title: Tobacco stocks tank in early trade; Godfrey Phillips down 10%
articles.summary: From February 1, pan masala, cigarettes, tobacco and similar products will attract a GST rate of 40%, while ‘beedi' will attract 18% Goods and Services Tax (GST), according to a government notification

articles.title: Additional excise duty on tobacco, health cess on pan masala to be effective February 1
articles.summary: From February 1, pan masala, cigarettes, tobacco and similar products will attract a GST rate of 40%, while biris will attract 18% Goods and Services Tax (GST), according to a government notification

articles.summary: The central government has approved 22 new projects under the Electronics Component Manufacturing Scheme (ECMS), clearing investments worth INR 41,863…

articles.title: Social media should take responsibility of content they publish: Union minister Vaishnaw
articles.summary: Social media companies must be accountable for the content they host, Union minister Ashwini Vaishnaw has emphasised. The Indian government is pushing for stricter laws to ensure this. Online platforms have been warned of legal action if they fail to remove obscene and unlawful material. This includes content generated by AI apps.

articles.title: India's exports may reach $950 billion in FY27 on West Asia trade pacts
articles.summary: India's export horizons are expanding rapidly, with projections hitting $840-850 billion in FY26 and climbing to $950 billion in FY27. The fostering of free trade agreements, particularly with nations in West Asia, alongside robust growth in sectors like services and electronics, are pivotal to this surge.

articles.title: Govt. notifies February 1 as the end of GST compensation cess, start of new tobacco tax regime
articles.summary: In a series of notifications on New Year’s Day, the Finance Ministry announced the end of GST compensation cess, the increase in the excise duty on tobacco products, and the new GST rates on these items as well

articles.title: Zero-duty market access to Indian exports, pledge to invest $20 billion, and more: Highlights of India-New Zealand free trade agreement
articles.summary: India has offered tariff liberalisation in 70% lines covering 95% of New Zealand India Bilateral trade

articles.title: GST collection grows 6.1% in December 2025 as rate-cut impact shows
articles.summary: The GST rate cuts effected in September 2025 made hundreds of items cheaper but reduced the central government's monthly GST revenue at the same time.

articles.title: Labour ministry proposes 90-day work threshold for gig workers’ social security eligibility
articles.summary: The draft rules detail how workdays will be calculated across multiple platforms, mandate Aadhaar-based registration, and place data-sharing and contribution compliance obligations on aggregators.

articles.title: MeitY takes cognisance of Grok misuse on X, action to follow soon: Secretary S Krishnan
articles.summary: The electronics and IT ministry has begun examining the alleged misuse of X’s AI tool Grok to generate obscene and non-consensual images, with MeitY Secretary S Krishnan indicating that regulatory action could be taken swiftly as scrutiny intensifies around platform accountability and AI safety.

articles.title: India-UK trade pact expected to come into force by first half of 2026: British envoy
articles.summary: A major trade deal between India and the United Kingdom is set for implementation in early 2026. This agreement aims to significantly boost trade between the two nations. Indian exporters will gain duty-free access to the UK market for most products.

articles.title: India's 'Reform Express' may have a difficult stretch ahead
articles.summary: India's government is pushing forward with ambitious reforms in 2025. While tax and financial changes are progressing, land acquisition and agricultural marketing reforms remain difficult. These crucial areas are key to India's manufacturing goals and rural economy. Addressing them will shape India's economic future. The government must navigate political sensitivities and economic realities to succeed.

articles.summary: Growth-generating capital expenditure can affect fiscal targets

articles.title: The Tencent-Flipkart test: Is New Delhi about to ease up on Chinese investment?
articles.summary: The government is weighing a proposal to exempt investments up to 26% from the rigorous security screening process mandated by PN(3), provided the foreign entity exercises no management control and holds no seat on the company’s board, two people familiar with the matter said.

articles.title: A year of insurance reforms in India, yet more ground to cover
articles.summary: Over the past year, India has rewritten key rules governing insurance. Yet for policyholders, the real test lies not in regulation, but in how these changes play out when a claim is filed.

articles.title: Government to release new series of retail inflation, GDP data from February, IIP from May next year
articles.summary: The Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation will hold a pre-release consultative workshop on the base revision of GDP, CPI, and IIP on December 23

articles.title: India-US trade talks, Trump and the China factor: Why New Delhi’s foreign policy faces its toughest test in 2026
articles.summary: As geopolitical fault lines deepen, former Indian diplomats warn that stalled trade talks with Washington reflect a broader strategic shift, forcing New Delhi to rethink how it balances the US, China and its own economic interests in a volatile global environment.

articles.title: After UP, Rajasthan Mandates Newspaper Reading In Government Schools
articles.summary: Expenditure towards newspaper subscriptions will be borne by Rajasthan School Education Council

articles.title: Government announces Rs 7,295-cr export package to improve exporters' access to credit
articles.summary: The government has unveiled a Rs 7,295-crore export support package, including a Rs 5,181-crore interest subvention scheme and Rs 2,114-crore collateral support, to enhance exporters' access to credit. These initiatives, spanning 2025-31, aim to address trade finance challenges, offering subsidies and guarantees to eligible MSMEs, particularly for defence and SCOMET products.

articles.title: Centre seeks proposals from states for setting up of AI centres
articles.summary: MeitY is urging state governments to submit proposals for establishing AI centers of excellence to bolster India's leadership in the Global South. This initiative, part of the ₹10,371.92 crore IndiaAI Mission, aims to transform R&D and benefit startups by expanding computing infrastructure and fostering inclusive AI deployment.

articles.title: Bihar Government announces healthcare facilities for elderly at doorsteps
articles.summary: The Chief Minister has instructed the Health Department to implement the scheme, which comes under the 'Saat Nischay' initiative of the Nitish Kumar Government, on a priority basis

articles.title: PM Modi reviews progress on overseas critical mineral acquisitions, ₹1,500-crore recycling incentive scheme
articles.summary: The review covered India’s efforts to secure long-term access to key minerals such as lithium, cobalt and rare earths, while scaling up domestic recycling capacity to reduce import dependence and support manufacturing under the Make in India programme.

articles.title: Govt extends last date for filing textile PLI scheme applications till March 31
articles.summary: The government has further extended the deadline for submission of fresh applications under the Production Linked Incentive (PLI) Scheme for Textiles till March 31.

articles.title: Labour Codes may spur hiring as firms get more flexibility to restructure
articles.summary: India’s new Labour Codes are expected to boost hiring by giving firms greater flexibility to restructure operations. The Industrial Relations Code raises the threshold for government approval for layoffs and closures to 300 workers from 100, easing compliance for MSMEs and mid-sized firms. Experts say labour-intensive sectors will benefit most, though some warn of higher labour turnover and income volatility.

articles.title: RBI continues to build forex reserves which rose to $696 billion
articles.summary: India’s forex reserves rose by $3.3 billion to $696.61 billion in the week ended December 26, RBI data showed. The increase was led by a sharp $2.95 billion jump in gold holdings and a modest rise in foreign currency assets. Reserves remain near record highs, providing cover for 9–10 months of imports amid global volatility.

articles.title: Centre designates core customs and indirect tax digital platforms as “critical information infrastructure” under IT Act
articles.summary: The Indian government has designated core customs and indirect tax digital platforms, including ICEGATE, ECCS, and ACES-GST, as "critical information infrastructure." This move significantly enhances cybersecurity controls and restricts access to authorized personnel only. Unauthorized access to these protected systems now carries criminal penalties under the Information Technology Act.

articles.title: India’s GST collections rise 6% to ₹1.75 lakh crore in December
articles.summary: India’s goods and services tax (GST) collections reached ₹1.75 lakh crore ($19.45 billion) in December, up 6.1% from the same month last year, the government said on Thursday.

articles.title: 35% of issues in big projects due to land acquisition; no plan to change law: Cabinet Secretary Somanathan
articles.summary: Update from Indian Express - Business

articles.title: No plan to change land acquisition policy, says cabinet secretary T V Somanathan
articles.summary: Officials said the PRAGATI platform has helped unlock stalled investments by resolving issues linked to land, environment and right of way, enabling large road, rail and power projects to move forward despite persistent structural challenges.

articles.title: Finding growth without overpaying is the real task now, says Axis MF's Shreyash Devalkar
articles.summary: Axis Mutual Fund’s Shreyash Devalkar said Indian equities are facing valuation pressure as most investment themes are already priced in. He is focusing on growth continuity and GARP opportunities, especially in potential turnaround sectors such as banks, lending, and parts of autos. He highlighted risks in high-valuation sectors, evolving consumption patterns in QSRs, and said inflation and policy cues will be key factors to track going ahead.

articles.title: Corporate affairs ministry orders probe against Shree Cement, seeks info
articles.summary: The Kolkata-based company stated that the development will have ”no impact on financial, business operations or other activities”.

articles.title: Sebi developing AI-driven tool to analyse cyber safety at entities
articles.summary: Sebi chairman Tuhin Kanta Pandey revealed that the markets regulator is spearheading the development of an innovative AI tool designed to assess the cyber safety of regulated entities. A dedicated working group will also focus on crafting a comprehensive technology roadmap for market infrastructure institutions, laying out a strategic vision for the next five and ten years.

articles.title: Make in India: Why sum of parts is bigger than the whole
articles.summary: India's Electronics Components Manufacturing Scheme (ECMS) is bolstering domestic production of critical parts, moving beyond mere assembly. With the recent approval of its third tranche, ECMS is fostering a comprehensive electronics ecosystem, aiming to significantly increase local value addition and strengthen supply chain resilience.

articles.title: Govt proposes 90-day work requirement for gig workers to get social security
articles.summary: In a significant move, gig and platform workers will soon be required to log a minimum number of working days to qualify for social security benefits. Proposed regulations indicate a threshold of 90 days with a single aggregator or 120 days across various platforms each year. This initiative is designed to integrate workers into essential programs like Ayushman Bharat.

articles.title: India’s fiscal fault lines between Centre and states return to the spotlight
articles.summary: Recent changes to India's rural job guarantee scheme have brought back into the spotlight long-running disputes between the Union government and states on how financial resources should be shared.

articles.title: China hails India overtaking Japan as world’s 4th largest economy, says ‘true strength comes from…’
articles.summary: The Central government announced on Tuesday, December 30, that India has surpassed Japan to become the world's fourth-largest economy with a size of USD 4.18 trillion

articles.title: Govt keeps small savings interest rates unchanged for the March quarter
articles.summary: The government has kept interest rates for popular small savings schemes such as the Public Provident Fund (PPF) and the National Savings Certificate (NSC) unchanged for the eighth consecutive quarter.

articles.title: ₹6,000 crore to BJP — 12 times what Congress got: Top political donors in FY25 revealed!
articles.summary: In the 2024-25, the BJP bagged most of the political donations, securing over ₹6,000 crore compared to Congress's mere ₹522 crore. This funding surge follows the Supreme Court's scrapping of the Electoral Bond scheme, shifting the landscape of political financing in India.

articles.title: Public universities on the brink, urgent reforms needed: Mahamaitri
articles.summary: In a press release, Janandolana Mahamaitri also called for the establishment of a new Higher Education Commission to safeguard the future of universities

articles.summary: UPI transactions surged 17.02% to Rs 1.12 lakh crore on December 31, according to RBI's payments settlement data, up from Rs 93,147.85 crore on NYE last year.

articles.title: India’s AI Leap: Why application lifecycle management platforms will define enterprise success
articles.summary: Unlike traditional applications, agentic systems must monitor themselves in production, adapt to dynamic data and user behaviour, operate within strict compliance constraints, and be explainable to business users and regulators. However, most platforms are not designed to support this.

articles.title: Social media should take responsibility for the content they publish: Ashwini Vaishnaw
articles.summary: The Centre has earlier this week warned online platforms—mainly social media firms—of legal consequences if they fail to act on obscene, vulgar, pornographic, paedophilic, and other forms of unlawful content.

articles.title: Infra firm RKCPL, Chartered Speed, 6 others get Sebi nod to float IPOs
articles.summary: The other firms to receive regulatory nod are Shriram Food Industry, Vadodara-based Tempsens Instruments (India) Ltd, Indira IVF and Rays Of Belief Ltd.

articles.title: GST, cess levy together to help detect evasion in pan masala sector: Sources
articles.summary: Finance Ministry introduces health and national security cess on pan masala manufacturing with 40 percent GST, creating a dual tax system to curb evasion and protect revenue from February 1.

articles.title: Tobacco industry body flags risks of steep excise duty hike, urges policy review
articles.summary: The Tobacco Institute of India warns that the sharp excise duty hike could harm farmers, MSMEs, and boost illicit trade, urging the government to reconsider its decision.

articles.title: Centre pre-publishes draft rules on four labour codes to seek stakeholders' feedback
articles.summary: The Ministry of Labour and Employment pre-published draft rules for four labour codes, aiming full implementation by April 1, 2026, to boost worker protection and simplify compliance nationwide.

articles.title: Electronics production plugs into over Rs 41.5k crore investments
articles.summary: The approved projects—spread across eight states and led by subsidiaries of Foxconn, Tata Electronics, Samsung, TDK, Wipro and Hindalco—are expected to generate production worth Rs 2.58 lakh crore and create 33,791 direct jobs, the Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology (MeitY) said.

articles.title: ET Budget Survey: Tax cuts, defence boost and what else? Tell us your Budget wish list
articles.summary: Union Budget 2026: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman will present the Union Budget 2026-27 soon. This budget is crucial for India's economic growth and its goal to become a developed nation. The government is focusing on reforms and technology to boost competitiveness. India aims to strengthen its position as a global services powerhouse despite international challenges.

articles.title: Chip industry pushes back as govt plans market-linked DLI 2.0 sops
articles.summary: Under DLI 1.0, companies were required to first spend their own money and then claim up to 50% reimbursement from the government, with the support capped at Rs 15 crore per applicant. In DLI 2.0, the proposal is to move to a joint funding mechanism: for every rupee put in by a company’s investors, the government would put in an equal amount.

articles.title: The week in charts: Sensex resilience, strong industrial output, new era in India-Australia trade
articles.summary: In this weekly Plain Facts compilation, we present to you data-based insights, with easy-to-read charts, to help you delve deeper into the stories reported by Mint in the week gone by.

articles.title: FDs vs small savings schemes: Which one should you choose and why?
articles.summary: For the eighth consecutive quarter, the government has kept the interest rates for small savings schemes unchanged.

articles.title: T.N. CM Stalin releases new app to seek views on party’s manifesto
articles.summary: The party has already constituted a manifesto committee, headed by DMK Parliamentary Party leader Kanimozhi

articles.summary: “The meeting focussed on issues regarding national security, disaster management, cyber security and regional infrastructure,” say sources

articles.summary: General Education Minister says decision taken in the wake of opposition from teachers’ organisations, reiterates that State will file review petition against Supreme Court ruling on TET

articles.title: India steps into 2026 with a brand new global playbook
articles.summary: India is shifting to a pragmatic, interest-based foreign policy for 2026, moving away from rigid alliances. This new global playbook prioritizes economic resilience through diversified trade, energy security via Russian oil purchases, and cautious engagement with China. The strategy aims for flexibility and autonomy, balancing partnerships with national interests in a multipolar world.

articles.title: India extends provisional anti-dumping duty on low-ash metallurgical coke imports from six countries till 30 June
articles.summary: The move came after an investigation found that imports dumped from Australia, China, Colombia, Indonesia, Japan and Russia were causing material injury to the domestic industry.

articles.title: Cabinet clears  ₹20,688 crore highway projects in Maharashtra, Odisha
articles.summary: The approved road projects include the country's largest ever highway project under the build-operate-transfer model, a greenfield 374-km Nashik-Solapur-Akkalkot corridor in Maharashtra

articles.title: India's fiscal deficit hits  ₹9.76 trillion, nearly two-thirds of target
articles.summary: Better-than-expected non-tax revenue collection of ₹5.16 trillion, or 88.6% of the full-year budget estimate, cushioned the central government's finances.

articles.title: RBI cautions against risks to economy even as fundamentals remain strong
articles.summary: The RBI cautioned against a sudden and sharp correction in the US equity market. Such a situation, it said, could cause a correction in domestic equities, affect investor confidence and wealth,

articles.title: India imposes three-year safeguard duty on some steel products to curb cheap imports
articles.summary: The measure, which was published on the official government gazette, excludes imports from certain developing countries, though China, Vietnam, and Nepal will be subject to the levy. It also will not apply to specialty steel products such as stainless steel.

articles.title: India imposes three-year tariff on some steel products after ‘sudden, sharp’ increase in imports
articles.summary: China, Vietnam, and Nepal will be subject to the levy; known as a safeguard duty, it be imposed at 12% in the ​first year followed by 11.5% in ⁠the second year and then 11% in the third year

articles.title: India is now fourth largest economy, says govt.
articles.summary: The government says that with the GDP valued at $4.18 trillion, “India has surpassed Japan to become the world’s fourth largest economy”, it says that the country is “poised to displace Germany from the third rank” with a projected GDP of $7.3 trillion by 2030

articles.title: Who is VV Rajesh? Meet the lawyer who become BJP’s first mayor of Thiruvananthapuram
articles.summary: VV Rajesh, a seasoned politician and lawyer,  has been elected as BJP's first-ever mayoral for Thiruvananthapuram, marking a historic shift in local governance after 45 years of Left rule. Discover how his political journey shaped this monumental moment for the saffron party.

articles.title: Chicago Council Passes 2026 Budget to Close $1.2 Billion Gap
articles.summary: Chicago’s City Council passed a roughly $16 billion budget for 2026 — less than two weeks before the deadline — without certainty about whether Mayor Brandon Johnson will sign or veto the plan.

articles.title: Business events that shaped India in 2025
articles.summary: From Trump’s trade war to RBI repo rate cuts and major corporate entries, 2025 delivered several notable developments. Though not all were transformational, a few deserve closer attention.

articles.title: Andhra govt approves greenfield port, mega shipbuilding cluster in Tirupati district
articles.summary: Special Chief Secretary of Infrastructure & Investment (Ports) Department, MT Krishna Babu said the greenfield port and the shipbuilding cluster are proposed under the Shipbuilding Development Scheme (SbDS) of the Ministry of Ports Shipping and Waterways (MoPSW).

articles.title: Delay of over four years pushes up bullet train project cost by 83%
articles.summary: Update from Times of India - Business

articles.title: LIC launches special campaign to revive lapsed policies
articles.summary: LIC has launched a two-month campaign from January 1 to March 2, 2026, to revive lapsed individual policies. The drive offers up to a 30% concession on late fees for non-linked policies, capped at Rs 5,000, and a 100% waiver for micro insurance. This initiative aims to help policyholders restore their insurance cover.

articles.title: Denial of limestone export data to Bangladesh justified; no larger public interest: CIC
articles.summary: The Central Information Commission has upheld the denial of exporter-wise details for limestone sold to Bangladesh. This information is protected under the commercial confidence clause. The commission stated that releasing such data could harm exporters' competitive positions. No overriding public interest was found to justify disclosure.

articles.title: Budget 2026: A top-up on tax reforms can shore up consumer confidence
articles.summary: India's economy thrives on domestic consumption, with upcoming Budget 2026 focusing on sustaining household purchasing power. GST 2.0 aims to boost disposable incomes and affordability through simplified rates and broader coverage. Reforms like bringing petroleum products and real estate under GST, alongside input tax credit and refund enhancements, are key to strengthening demand and fostering long-term growth.

articles.title: 8th Pay Commission: Who will get the most salary hike after January 1, 2026 — Junior or senior employees? Explained
articles.summary: 8th Pay Commission: Even though the in-hand salary of employees will receive only after the 8th Pay Commission announcement is made officially, the arrears will begin to accumulate from January. They will be released after the provisions of the 8th Pay Commission is announced.

articles.title: Tax, NPS, labour codes: How 2025's changes will affect your wallet in 2026
articles.summary: From tax reforms to new labour codes, here are the important changes from 2025 that demand a fresh look at your money strategy for the coming year.

articles.title: 8th Pay Commission comes into effect from 1 January, but your salary will not increase right now | Explained
articles.summary: With the 8th Pay Commission members announced, employees are now expecting a salary hike soon. What happens then?

articles.title: Election Commission Details 91.46 Lakh Voter Discrepancy Cases In West Bengal
articles.summary: Currently, the cases of these "unmapped" voters are being heard by the Commission

articles.title: Without a vote cast, Mahayuti headed to win 68 seats in Maharashtra civic polls: Here's what's happening
articles.summary: The State Election Commission (SEC) has asked returning officers not to declare results in these wards until an investigation is completed.

articles.title: Pro-startups, not pro-exploitation: Rajya Sabha MP Raghav Chadha reacts to Eternal CEO remarks
articles.summary: Chadha’s post on X followed Eternal CEO Deepinder Goyal’s statements defending the gig model by citing rising earnings and flexible work patterns. He emphasised that labour protections are necessary.

articles.title: Delhi govt agrees in principle to allow privately-owned EVs to operate as shared taxis
articles.summary: The Delhi government has agreed in principle to allow privately-owned electric vehicles to operate as shared taxis, even as cab aggregators have said they will roll out shared rides that will also involve women drivers within a month, officials said on Friday.

articles.title: India to showcase AI case studies to global leaders at upcoming Summit
articles.summary: The ministry of electronics and information technology (MeitY) has also released calls for proposals on priority areas such as education, agriculture, and disabilities, which will be presented by a host of academic institutions, startups and not-for-profit foundations from India.

articles.title: Zomato delivery partners’ hourly earnings rose 10.9% in 2025, union questions ‘decent work’ claims
articles.summary: Average earnings per hour for delivery partners on Zomato rose to Rs 102 in 2025, up from Rs 92 in 2024, marking a 10.9% year-on-year increase, according to a fact sheet released by Eternal CEO Deepinder Goyal on X. However, the Telangana Gig and Platform Workers Union countered that the gig workers’ income does not constitute “decent work”. It questioned the sustainability of low incomes for workers relying on gig platforms as their primary source of livelihood.

articles.title: IIT Madras inks global MoUs as part of international expansion
articles.summary: The Indian Institute of Technology Madras (IIT Madras) on Friday announced a series of international partnerships with academic institutions, industry players and government bodies across Germany, Malaysia, Singapore, the UAE, the UK and the US, marking a major push in its global expansion efforts.

articles.title: Four semiconductor plants in India to begin commercial production in 2026
articles.summary: Union Minister for Electronics and IT Ashwini Vaishnaw announced on Friday that four companies will commence commercial manufacturing of semiconductor chips in 2026, marking a significant milestone in India's push for self-reliance in critical technology.

articles.title: India urges Russia to lower trade barriers for Indian exports amid rouble pile-up
articles.summary: India is pushing Russia to remove trade hurdles for its electronics, engineering goods, food, and fisheries. This move aims to unlock billions of roubles stuck in Russian banks due to oil imports. Indian exporters face challenges with Russian standards and software requirements.

articles.title: India manufacturing PMI slows to two-year low in December, but sector ends 2025 on resilient note
articles.summary: India's manufacturing sector experienced a slowdown in December, reaching a two-year low as new orders, output, and employment eased. Despite this, the industry concluded 2025 on a resilient note, with strong demand expected to sustain activity. While export orders saw a dip, manufacturers anticipate future growth, though business sentiment has softened.

articles.title: India’s forex reserves rise by $3.29 billion to $696.61 billion as of December 26, 2025
articles.summary: India's foreign exchange reserves surged by $3.29 billion to $696.61 billion in the week ending December 26, 2025. This marks a second consecutive week of growth, following a substantial $4.36 billion increase in the preceding week. The Reserve Bank of India's data highlights a robust upward trend in the nation's forex holdings.

articles.title: 2026 dawns brightly on buoyant sentiment as India’s economy hits high gear
articles.summary: India's economy is experiencing a strong start to 2026. December data reveals high consumer sentiment and robust economic activity. Car sales reached a record high, and Goods and Services Tax collections remained strong. Industrial output saw significant growth, and digital payment transactions scaled new peaks. Fuel sales also exceeded yearly averages, indicating a positive economic outlook.

articles.title: Cross-border ecommerce set to get easier; Focus on MSMEs
articles.summary: Cross-border ecommerce is set to become easier for Indian businesses, particularly MSMEs. The government is considering relaxing rules for returning goods and increasing the value limit for courier exports. This move aims to support small businesses and artisans. Dedicated ecommerce export hubs will streamline logistics and customs processes.

articles.title: EV charging startup Kazam closes FY25 at Rs 40 crore, targets Rs 100 crore run rate
articles.summary: IFC-backed EV charging startup Kazam posted Rs 40 crore revenue in FY25 as demand shifts towards reliable, high-usage infrastructure. The company expects Rs 100 crore revenue and profitability by early 2026, driven by strong growth in tier 2 and 3 cities. The platform currently manages over 9,000 MWh of energy transactions every month, up nearly 60% from June 2025, it said in a statement.

articles.title: In the beauty game, quick commerce's serving all the looks
articles.summary: Quick commerce is reshaping India’s beauty market, with skincare and makeup now bought on impulse and delivered in minutes rather than planned online shopping. The category has surged sharply, reaching about $100 million a month, growing far faster than traditional ecommerce and attracting premium brands.

articles.title: Bharat Taxi to launch by January-end after pilot run
articles.summary: Bharat Taxi has been recording an average of 5,500 rides daily, including 4,000 from the airport and 1,500 from other locations across cab, auto, and bike categories. More than 1.4 lakh drivers have registered on the app so far.

articles.title: Govt okays 22 proposals under ECMS with planned investment of Rs 41,863 Cr
articles.summary: The approved proposals include those from Dixon, Samsung Display Noida Pvt Ltd, Foxconn, and Hindalco Industries. These approvals are expected to spur 33,791 direct employment opportunities.

articles.title: Temperatures dip below zero in most parts of Kashmir
articles.summary: The famous ski resort of Gulmarg in north Kashmir remained the coldest spot, with the mercury dipping to minus 6.5 degrees Celsius, while the tourist resort of Pahalgam in south Kashmir recorded a low of minus 5.2 degrees Celsius.

articles.title: Former Kerala transport minister Antony Raju found guilty of evidence tampering in 1990 drug case
articles.summary: Antony Raju, Janadhipathya Kerala Congress MLA, was convicted for tampering evidence in a 1990 drug case involving Andre Salvatore Cervelli at Thiruvananthapuram airport.

articles.title: Maharashtra's IRB Sindhudurg airport gets DGCA nod for 24x7 all-weather operations
articles.summary: IRB Sindhudurg Airport gets DGCA approval for 24x7 all-weather operations, IFR certification, and expanded parking, boosting Konkan connectivity and tourism as passenger traffic surges.

articles.title: IDBI Bank reports double-digit growth in Q3; advances rise 15%
articles.summary: IDBI Bank reported 12 percent business growth to ₹5.47 lakh crore as of December 31, 2025, with advances and deposits rising. Shares hit an 11-year high before the Q3 update.

articles.title: CIEL HR Services mops up ₹30 cr from Zoho, Pegasus, others in pre-IPO round
articles.summary: CIEL HR Services raised ₹30 crore from 88 investors including Zoho Corporation, Pegasus India and Standard Fireworks ahead of its IPO, aiming to expand subsidiaries and HR tech platforms.

articles.title: At least 7 explosions and low-flying aircraft are heard in Venezuela’s Caracas
articles.summary: Caracas residents reported loud explosions, aircraft overflights, gunshots, and power outages amid US sanctions on Venezuelan oil firms and tankers, with OPEC plus Venezuela in focus for 2026.

articles.title: Bought Coal India shares before Jan 1, 2026? Here's some news for you
articles.summary: Bharat Coking Coal Ltd., a Coal India Ltd. subsidiary, launches its IPO on Dalal Street from January 9 to 13, 2026, with 46.57 crore shares and special quotas for shareholders.

articles.title: V2 Retail Q3 update: revenue jumps 57% as store expansion drives growth
articles.summary: V2 Retail’s Q3 revenue surged 57% to ₹927 crore, driven by 35 new stores in Tier 2 and Tier 3 cities, steady demand, and a focus on expanding its retail footprint across India.

articles.title: M&M Financial Q3 update: disbursements seen up 7%, assets up 12%
articles.summary: Mahindra & Mahindra Financial Services Q3 FY26 disbursements rose 7 percent to ₹17,600 crore, assets up 12 percent, asset quality stable, liquidity buffer over ₹8,850 crore as of December 31.

articles.title: Canada seeks probe from Air India after pilot found unfit for duty at Vancouver
articles.summary: Transport Canada asked Air India to investigate after a pilot was found drunk before flight AI186 at Vancouver International Airport, warning of penalties and stressing passenger safety.

articles.title: RailOne app will soon be the only authorised app for unreserved ticket booking: Railways
articles.summary: Union Railway Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw launched RailOne in July 2025 on the 40th Foundation Day of Centre for Railway Information Systems (CRIS).

articles.title: J&K Bank reports double-digit growth in total business in Q3
articles.summary: Jammu and Kashmir Bank’s Q3 business rose 13.34% to ₹2.72 lakh crore, with deposits up 10.58%. CASA ratio fell to 44.10%, reflecting more term deposits.

articles.title: Several people injured in fatal fire at Swiss bar remain unidentified, it's an unbearable wait
articles.summary: Arthur Brodard is missing after a fire at Le Constellation bar in Crans-Montana killed 40 and injured 119. Families await DNA results as officials investigate safety violations.

articles.title: ‘Ikkis’ box office collection Day 2: Agastya Nanda’s war drama makes ₹3.5 crore
articles.summary: Agastya Nanda’s war drama Ikkis has crossed the ₹10 crore total box office collection mark by its second day of release.

articles.summary: He expressed concern that without local consent, Chinese troops in Balochistan would pose an "unimaginable threat" and "challenge" to the futures of both India and Balochistan.

articles.title: RBL Bank Q3 Update | Advances rise 13%, deposits grow 12%
articles.summary: Deposits below ₹3 crore increased 15% year-on-year and 4% sequentially to ₹61,632 crore, compared with ₹53,719 crore a year earlier. These deposits accounted for around 51.5% of the bank’s total deposits as of December 31, 2025. Shares of RBL Bank Ltd ended at ₹320.80, up by ₹1.74, or 5.50%, on the BSE.

articles.title: New Year’s Eve strike by gig workers exposes cracks in India’s 10-minute delivery model
articles.summary: The flash strike by app-based delivery workers has reignited concerns over ultra-fast delivery timelines, wage stagnation and safety risks, even as the Centre moves to roll out social security rules for gig workers in a rapidly expanding platform economy.

articles.title: Adani Enterprises launches ₹1,000-cr NCD issue with green shoe option, subscription opens Jan 6
articles.summary: The NCDs will be listed on both the BSE and NSE. Each NCD has a face value of ₹1,000, with a minimum application of 10 NCDs and multiples of one NCD thereafter, making the minimum application ₹10,000. Shares of Adani Enterprises Ltd ended at ₹2,278, up by ₹18.00, or 0.80%, on the BSE today, January 2.

articles.title: Union Bank of India Q3 Update | Gross advances rise 7.13%; RAM advances up 11.49%
articles.summary: Domestic advances grew 7.42% year-on-year to ₹9,80,643 crore in the December quarter, up from ₹9,12,927 crore last year. Sequentially, domestic advances increased 4.07% from ₹9,42,273 crore. Shares of Union Bank of India Ltd ended at ₹157, up by ₹3.42, or 2.23%, on the BSE today, January 2.

articles.title: Avenue Supermarts Q3 Update | Revenue higher at ₹17,613 crore, store count at 442
articles.summary: Avenue Supermarts Q3 Update | Revenue for the quarter ended December 31, 2024, was ₹15,565.23 crore. Shares of Avenue Supermarts Ltd ended at ₹3,721, up by ₹0.13, or 4.90%, on the BSE.

articles.title: Suzuki Motorcycle India sales up 26% at 1,22,366 units in December
articles.summary: Suzuki Motorcycle India Pvt Ltd reported 1,22,366 units sold in December 2025, a 26% rise. Deepak Mutreja highlighted strong growth and plans for expanded customer services.

articles.title: AI-led productivity, not trade wars, to drive the next global growth phase: William Lee
articles.summary: William Lee, Chief Economist and Managing Director at Global Economic Advisors, said India must provide clearer signals to fully capitalise on the emerging global economic shift. This includes unequivocally welcoming foreign investment, opening markets further, and dismantling long-standing political barriers.

articles.title: India's April-November fiscal deficit at 62.3% of 2025/26 target
articles.summary: India’s fiscal deficit hit 9.8 trillion rupees in April-November, 62.3% of the yearly estimate, with net tax receipts at 13.9 trillion rupees and capital expenditure at 6.6 trillion rupees.
